result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: Transcript received and filed for the following date and event: October 7, 2015 Sentencing hearing for 14CF1455 and Plea/Sentencing hearing for 15CF990 held before Judge Dreyfus; filed by Linda Coleman, court reporter. Transcripts maintained in filed 14CF1455 adn 15CF990.

Defendant Marlin T Dupler in court with attorney Jorge R Fragoso.  
Case called along with:  14CF1455, 14TR7622 & 14TR7623

Matter is dismissed and read into case:  14CF1455.

Refund $750 of the cash bail to the posting party and transfer the balance to case 14CF1455.
Court received information from Wisconsin Community Services regarding defendant's compliance/non-compliance.
